s0001.literal: Emperor Wen the Filial was Gaozu's middle son, his mother was Consort Bo.
s0001.idiomatic: Emperor Wen the Filial was Gaozu's middle son, with Consort Bo as his mother.

s0002.literal: In Gaozu's eleventh year, he executed Chen Xi, pacified Dai territory, and established him as King of Dai, with capital at Zhongdu.
s0002.idiomatic: In Gaozu's eleventh year, after executing Chen Xi and pacifying the territory of Dai, he was established as King of Dai with his capital at Zhongdu.

s0003.literal: Seventeenth year, autumn, Empress Gao passed away; the various Lü plotted disorder, wishing to endanger the Liu clan.
s0003.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, autumn, Empress Gao passed away; the various Lü clansmen plotted rebellion, seeking to endanger the Liu family.

s0004.literal: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, Marquis Zhu Xu Liu Zhang and others together executed them.
s0004.idiomatic: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, and Marquis Zhu Xu Liu Zhang joined forces to execute them.

s0005.literal: 迎立代王，是為孝文皇帝。
s0005.idiomatic: They welcomed and established the King of Dai as emperor—this was Emperor Wen the Filial.

s0006.literal: 元年冬十月庚戌，皇帝即位于高廟。
s0006.idiomatic: First year, winter, tenth month, day Gengxu, the Emperor ascended the throne at the Gao Temple.

s0007.idiomatic: On the day Dingyou, he granted amnesty to the world.

s0008.idiomatic: Twelfth month, Chen Ping passed away.

s0009.idiomatic: Spring, first month, he established the crown prince.

s0010.idiomatic: He granted the people's eldest sons nobility rank of one level.

s0011.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, he granted amnesty to criminals.

s0012.idiomatic: Fifth month, he established Empress Dou.

s0013.idiomatic: Sixth month, Chancellor Guan Ying passed away.

s0014.literal: 二年春二月，孝文皇帝從代來至。
s0014.idiomatic: Second year, spring, second month, Emperor Wen came from Dai and arrived.

s0015.idiomatic: He abolished the requirement for passes at the border checkpoints.

s0016.idiomatic: Third month, he granted amnesty to the world.

s0017.literal: 夏四月丙戌，立太子母竇氏為皇后。
s0017.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, day Bingxu, he established the crown prince's mother, Consort Dou, as Empress.

s0018.idiomatic: On the day Dinghai, he granted amnesty to the world.

s0019.literal: 五月，詔曰：「古者天子五載一巡狩。
s0019.idiomatic: Fifth month, edict said: 'In ancient times, the Son of Heaven conducted inspection tours every five years.

s0020.idiomatic: He visited the feudal lords at the appropriate seasons.

s0021.literal: 春行所至，必先即事蒞民。
s0021.idiomatic: When traveling in spring, wherever he went, he would first attend to affairs and visit the people.

s0022.idiomatic: He established teachings for the people to examine the true situation.

s0023.literal: 今寡人新即位，曰緬未覩。」
s0023.idiomatic: Now I have newly ascended the throne and have not yet seen these things.'

s0024.literal: 六月，代王參為太原王，參薨。
s0024.idiomatic: Sixth month, King of Dai Shen became King of Taiyuan; Shen passed away.

s0025.idiomatic: Autumn, ninth month, he granted amnesty to criminals.

s0026.literal: 三年冬十月丁酉晦，日有蝕之。
s0026.idiomatic: Third year, winter, tenth month, day Dingyou (last day), solar eclipse.

s0027.literal: 十一月壬子，詔曰：「前執法之吏，或以為威眾。
s0027.idiomatic: Eleventh month, day Renzi, edict said: 'Former law enforcement officials sometimes used it to intimidate the masses.

s0028.idiomatic: Some used it for private favoritism.

s0029.idiomatic: Rather than not enforcing it, it is better to be lenient.'

s0030.literal: 減答三百曰二百，答二百曰一百。
s0030.idiomatic: He reduced the punishment of three hundred strokes to two hundred, and two hundred strokes to one hundred.

s0031.idiomatic: Spring, second month, he granted amnesty to the world.

s0032.literal: 三月，詔曰：「農，天下之本也。
s0032.idiomatic: Third month, edict said: 'Agriculture is the foundation of the world.

s0033.literal: 其開藉田，朕親率耕，以給宗廟粢盛。」
s0033.idiomatic: Let the imperial field be opened; I will personally lead the plowing to provide grain offerings for the ancestral temples.'

s0034.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, he granted amnesty to the world.

s0035.literal: 五月，詔曰：「孝悌天下之大順也。
s0035.idiomatic: Fifth month, edict said: 'Filial piety and fraternal duty are the greatest harmony in the world.

s0036.idiomatic: Diligent farming is the greatest foundation of the world.

s0037.idiomatic: The elders of three are the greatest teachers of the world.

s0039.literal: 其開庠序之教，養天下之老。」
s0039.idiomatic: Let the schools be opened to teach, and support the elderly of the world.'

s0040.idiomatic: Sixth month, Chancellor Zhang Cang passed away.

s0041.idiomatic: Autumn, ninth month, he granted amnesty to the world.

s0042.literal: 四年冬十二月，丞相申屠嘉卒。
s0042.idiomatic: Fourth year, winter, twelfth month, Chancellor Shen Tu Jia passed away.
